page.topic: Returning a Different Field Than You Display

section.description: Frequently in a database application you will want to display one field value while storing a different field value. For example, you might want to display "Alaska" but store "AK". You might want to display a user's full name, but store his or her employee number. The following two examples show how to use this technique with a drop down list of choices

section.title: Using a WHILE ... END WHILE Loop

step.description: Create a new A5W page with the following content.
step.example:
The drop-down list below is dynamically built from the AlphaSports customer table.
It displays each customer's name in the drop-down, but when one is selected, it returns the customer id instead of the name.

<%A5 if eval_valid("cCmd") then     if cCmd = "Select" then         ? "The previously selected value was: " + cSelectBox + "
"     end if end if %>

case.title: Things to note in this page include:

case.description: It is DIMmed implicitly by the statement...
This means that Alpha Five knows out that pTbl is a Pointer variable because the table.open() function creates a pointer variable.
2. cCmd is a character variable created by the statement...
This mean that cCmd does not exist until the page has been run at least once. The eval_valid("cCmd") expression tests to see if cCmd exists before displaying the selected customer_id value.
3. The form ACTION=" <%A5 ? Request.Script_Name %> " expression causes the page to be reloaded after you select an entry from the list box and store it in the cSelectBox variable.

The pTbl.fetch eof() method returns .T. (TRUE) when you have read the last record in a table. Consequently, the expression .not. pTbl.fetch eof() returns .F. (FALSE) and ends the WHILE ... END WHILE loop after you read the last record.
The VALUE=" <%A5 ? pTbl.customer_id %> " statement sets the value that the list box returns when you select one of its entries.
The <%A5 ? pTbl.firstname + " " + pTbl.lastname %> expression between the <OPTION ...> and </OPTION> tags specifies the data to display in the list box. This is different than the data that is saved.

step.description: Select File > Save As and name the page "Save_Different_Value_1".
Click the 'lightning' icon to run the page in Live Preview.
Create a new A5W page with the following content.
step.example:
Below is a drop-down list similar to above, but it is built using the TABLE.EXTERNAL_RECORD_CONTENT_GET() function.
This method should run faster than a WHILE ... END WHILE loop.

<%A5 if eval_valid("cCmd2") then     if cCmd2 = "Select" then         ? "The previously selected value was: " + cSelectBox + "
"     end if end if %>

case.description: Many of the features of this page are the same as "Save_Different_Value_1.a5w".

However, the process of loading the cOptions into the list box is different. The entries that you see in the list box come from the cOptions character variable, which is implicitly DIMmed by the TABLE.EXTERNAL_RECORD_CONTENT_GET() method, which returns a character value.

This method creates a CR-LF delimited list of entries of a specified format. In this case each entry contains data from a record in the customer table. Each entry is of the format '' + firstname + ' ' + lastname.

Note that the expression above uses single quote marks around its literal values, so the entire expression can be wrapped in double quote marks, as required by the TABLE.EXTERNAL_RECORD_CONTENT_GET() method.
